As flarngus said, does not run on Windows 7. Tries to download updated files right at the start prior to installing.

@ripp1916 of course it would run in XP compatibility mode but that not technically running in Windows 7. XP compatibility mode actually starts a Virtual Machine that runs a freely provided copy of Windows XP that takes up a portion of your systems resources. Saying that it runs in XP compatibility mode is like saying it runs on Windows XP. This is known.

Something like WINE in Linux could be considered a "Compatibility Mode" but calling a Virtual Machine with a copy of Windows XP running on it is not something I would call a "Compatibility Mode". Of course you didn't name it this i know but just so you are clear that running it this way does not mean it's running in Windows 7.

If I install VMWare Workstation in Windows 7 and install Ubuntu Linux in it and then install a Linux program inside of that, it doesn't mean that program is now compatible with Windows 7.

Disregard what I said about the compatibility mode. I was confused and referring to something else. It does work with the Windows 7 Compatibility mode.

Just right click on the file and select properties, then go to the compatibility tab and select Windows XP.
